chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: lattice
P: Lattice.sort T
s: Pred (ideal P)
p: ideal P

Goal:
p \In s -> p <== ideal_sup s

Premises:
Notation Lattice T m := (Lattice.pack id)
ideal_sup = fun s : Pred (ideal P) => {| id_val := ideal_sup' s; id_pf := ideal_supP' s |} : Pred (ideal P) -> ideal P
ideal : forall T : poset, T -> Type
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> seq A -> Prop
Equality.sort = fun t : eqType => let (sort, _) := t in sort : eqType -> Type Equality.sort is a coercion
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
ideal_sup' = fun s : Pred (ideal P) => sup [Pred x | exists p : ideal P, p \In s /\ id_val p = x] : Pred (ideal P) -> T
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [T : lattice P : T s : Pred (ideal P) p : ideal P |- Type] ?T' : [T : lattice P : T s : Pred (ideal P) p : ideal P |- Type] ?f : [T : lattice P : T s : Pred (ideal P) p : ideal P |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [T : lattice P : T s : Pred (ideal P) p : ideal P |- ?T'] ?s : [T : lattice P : T s : Pred (ideal P) p : ideal P |- seq ?T]
fun_supP : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), p \In s -> p <== fun_sup s
pair_supP : forall (A B : lattice) (s : Pred (A * B)) (p : A * B), p \In s -> p <== pair_sup s
fun_supM : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), (forall q : A -> B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> fun_sup s <== p
dfun_supP : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> lattice) (s : Pred (dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x))) (p : dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x)), p \In s -> p <== dfun_sup s
ideal_supP' : forall s : Pred (ideal P), ideal_sup' s <== P
relaxP : forall (T : poset) (P1 P2 : T), P1 <== P2 -> forall p : T, p <== P1 -> p <== P2
pair_supM : forall (A B : lattice) (s : Pred (A * B)) (p : A * B), (forall q : A * B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> pair_sup s <== p
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
idealPosetMixin : forall (T : poset) (P : T), Poset.mixin_of (ideal P)
dfun_supM : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> lattice) (s : Pred (dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x))) (p : dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x)), (forall q : dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x), q \In s -> q <== p) -> dfun_sup s <== p
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> sup s <== x
supP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== sup s
Znumtheory.prime_intro : forall p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) p -> (forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH) n /\ BinInt.Z.lt n p -> Znumtheory.rel_prime n p) -> Znumtheory.prime p
relax : forall (T : poset) (P1 P2 : T), ideal P1 -> P1 <== P2 -> ideal P2
Record mixin_of (T : poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_sup : Pred T -> T; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x } Arguments Lattice.Mixin [T] [mx_sup]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope
infM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> x <== y) -> x <== inf s
infP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), x \In s -> inf s <== x
Lattice.sort = fun t : lattice => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : lattice -> Type Lattice.sort is a coercion
orpF : forall p : Prop, p \/ False < -> p
subp_refl : forall (T : Type) (p : Pred T), p <=p p
Simpl_PredE : forall (T : Type) (p : Pred T), p <~> [Pred x | p x]
toPred : forall (T : Type) (p : PredType T), p -> Pred T
Ideal : forall (T : poset) (P id_val : T), id_val <== P -> ideal P
Mem_Simpl : forall (T : Type) (p : Simpl_Pred T), Mem p = p
MemE : forall (T : Type) (p : Simpl_Pred T), Mem p = p
sub_supX : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> forall u : Pred (subPoset s), sub_sup' u \In s
BinIntDef.Z.of_N = fun n : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Npos p => BinNums.Zpos p end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_N _%N_scope
